name: Mechanical Engineering Technology Concepts

timeGuidelines.description: The standard instructional time for this course is 90 hours.

description: This design course introduces the basic building blocks required for the common core and the three specializations. Using wide-ranging, flexible design reasoning the learner will learn how to set up problems based on a good understanding of the underlying principles, choose a plan to solve them, and present the results. Cross-referenced to the National Technology Benchmarks (NTB).

assessment.description: Course Assessment: Assignments 70%, Final Exam 30%, Total: 100%

learningOutcomes.title: Analyse machines in 'socio-technical systems'
objectives: Categorize interactions between people and technology
Recognize various types of machines
Interpret material, energy, and signal transformations
Identify classes of basic functionalities
Examine existing designs using 'thought elements'

learningOutcomes.title: Apply techniques to broaden the problem
objectives: Recognize problems and constraints hidden in design briefs
Identify the essential problems
Identify the essential constraints

learningOutcomes.title: Use 'functional techniques' for initializing technical design efforts
objectives: Analyse problems and constraints for implied functionalities
Identify the essential functional requirements
Practice solving simple design problems based on function

learningOutcomes.title: Combine functionalities and methods to generate novel concepts
objectives: Identify basic design methods used by designers and styles
Compare and contrast rational and creative design methods for suitability in specific situations
Combine design methods to generate novel solutions that fulfill the design brief through satisfying the essential functional requirements

learningOutcomes.title: Select a concept that best resolves the problem
objectives: Compare and contrast available concepts
Determine the concept that most efficiently fulfills the essential functional requirements while overcoming problems and constraints
Illustrate how rational information and creative intuition led to design decisions
Demonstrate how the selected concept is an optimum design solution

learningOutcomes.title: Present final design concept
objectives: Demonstrate the functionality of the final design concept
Dramatize how the final design concept will be used
Illustrate how the design concept embedded into the socio-technical system

learningOutcomes.title: Practice 'design thinking' logic through graphics
objectives: Sketch schematics as a design logic
Sketch renderings as a design logic
Sketch projections as a design logic
Apply intellectual standards to graphics (clarity, accuracy, relevance, logicalness, breadth, precision, significance, completeness, fairness, and depth)

learningOutcomes.title: Perform technical writing that shows design reasoning
objectives: Accurately examine technical documents for design logic
Produce referenced design reports according to technical writing guidelines
Apply intellectual standards to writing (clarity, accuracy, relevance, logicalness, breadth, precision, significance, completeness, fairness, and depth)

learningOutcomes.title: Create objects that illustrate design reasoning through physical representations
objectives: Construct physical prototypes as aids for all stages of the design effort
Compare and contrast materials through experiments
Compare and contrast functional geometries through experiments
Categorize materials and processes for life-cycle

schedule.assessments: Project 2 Prototype Due, Theory Final Pt 1
Project 3 Prototype Due, Sketch Final Pt 2
